Package at.tugraz.ist.cc.error

Enum ErrorHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ErrorHandler>
      • at.tugraz.ist.cc.error.ErrorHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ErrorHandler>
    public enum ErrorHandler
extends java.lang.Enum<ErrorHandler>
    Singleton to handle all error and warnings occurring during the lexer, parser and type checker phase of the compiler. Use this class's methods to collect and print your errors for task 1 and 2.

    This class uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate JovaErrors with specified error messages and stores them in a 2-dimensional ArrayList errors. errors has a size of 4, that is one list for every error type (see LEX_ERR, PARSE_ERR, TYPE_ERR , TYPE_WARNING).

    Use the add..(..) methods to add errors which shall be printed later on.

    The methods printLexerErrors(), printParserErrors(), printTypeErrors() and printTypeWarnings() should be used to print the summary of previously added errors/warnings for the respective task.

    Since there is only one instance of this class it is might be necessary to use the method reset() during testing.

    If you encounter any bugs/typos etc. or have ideas on how to improve the framework please contact us via mail cc@ist.tugraz.at

    • Enum Constant Summary

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets errors by reinitializing it to a size of 4. Uses the initErrorList(int) method. May be used when performing unit tests. WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN CALLING THIS MEHTOD INSIDE YOUR COMPILER IMPLEMENTATION, SINCE THE TEST SYSTEM USES THIS CLASS' COLLECTIONS TO CHECK FOR THE REPORTED ERRORS.

      • printLexerErrors

        public void printLexerErrors()
        Prints a summary of previously added lexer errors in a formated way to stdout. Use this method for printing your lexer errors for task 1.

        Wrapper-method which uses checkAndPrintErrors(int) to print a summary of all errors of the lexer error type.

      • printParserErrors

        public void printParserErrors()
        Prints a summary of previously added parser errors in a formated way to stdout. Use this method for printing your parser errors for task 1.

        Wrapper-method which uses checkAndPrintErrors(int) to print a summary of all errors of the parser error type.

      • printTypeErrors

        public void printTypeErrors()
        Prints a summary of previously added type errors in a formated way to stdout. Use this method for printing your type errors for task 2.

        Wrapper-method which uses checkAndPrintErrors(int) to print a summary of all errors of the type error type.

      • printTypeWarnings

        public void printTypeWarnings()
        Prints a summary of previously added type warnings in a formated way to stdout. Use this method for printing your type warnings for task 2.

        Wrapper-method which uses checkAndPrintErrors(int) to print a summary of all warnings of the type warning type.

      • printTask1Errors

        public void printTask1Errors()
        Prints a summary of previously added lexer and parser errors in a formated way to stdout.

        Wrapper-method which uses checkAndPrintErrors(int) to print a summary of all errors specified for task 1.

        Does not print parser errors if lexer errors are present.

      • printTask2ErrorsAndWarnings

        public void printTask2ErrorsAndWarnings()
        Prints all previously added lexer, parser, type errors and type warnings in a formated way to stdout.

        Wrapper-method which uses checkAndPrintErrors(int) to print a summary of all errors and warning as specified for task 2.

        Stops printing the summary if errors are present.

      • getNumLexErrors

        public int getNumLexErrors()
        Returns the total number of lexer errors added to the error list.
        Returns:
        the size of the lexer error list.

      • getNumParseErrors

        public int getNumParseErrors()
        Returns the total number of parser errors added to the error list.
        Returns:
        the size of the parser error list.

      • getNumTypeErrors

        public int getNumTypeErrors()
        Returns the total number of type errors added to the error list.
        Returns:
        the size of the type error list.

      • addLexerError

        public void addLexerError​(int line,
                          int char_pos,
                          java.lang.String msg)
        Creates a new LexerError instance and adds it to the list of lexical errors. Use this method to add new lexer errors to errors.
        Parameters:
        line - the line number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        msg - a string with the error message to be printed

      • addBinaryTypeCoercionWarning

        public void addBinaryTypeCoercionWarning​(int line,
                                         int char_pos,
                                         java.lang.String op,
                                         java.lang.String found_lhs,
                                         java.lang.String found_rhs,
                                         java.lang.String res_lhs,
                                         java.lang.String res_rhs)
        Creates a new BinaryCoercionWarning instance and adds it to the list of type warnings. Use this method to add new coercion warnings for binary operators to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Operator 'op': Found types: 'found_lhs', 'found_rhs'. Coerced to: 'res_lhs', 'res_rhs'"

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the coercion occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the coercion occurred in the source file
        op - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the operator for which the coercion should be performed
        found_lhs - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type of the operator's left-hand side operand
        found_rhs - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type of the operator's right-hand side operand
        res_lhs - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type which is the result of the coercion for the operator's left-hand side operand
        res_rhs - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type which is the result of the coercion for the operator's right-hand side operand

      • addUnaryTypeCoercionWarning

        public void addUnaryTypeCoercionWarning​(int line,
                                        int char_pos,
                                        java.lang.String op,
                                        java.lang.String found_type,
                                        java.lang.String res_type)
        Creates a new UnaryCoercionWarning instance and adds it to the list of type warnings. Use this method to add new coercion warnings for unary operators to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Operator 'op': Found type: 'found_type'. Coerced to: 'result_type' "

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the coercion occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the coercion occurred in the source file
        op - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the operator for which the coercion should be performed
        found_type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type of the operator's operand
        res_type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type which is the result of the coercion for the operator's operand

      • addReturnTypeCoercionWarning

        public void addReturnTypeCoercionWarning​(int line,
                                         int char_pos,
                                         java.lang.String found_type,
                                         java.lang.String res_type)
        Creates a new ReturnCoercionWarning instance and adds it to the list of type warnings. Use this method to add new coercion warnings for return to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Return: Found type: 'found_type'. Coerced to: 'res_type'"

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the coercion occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the coercion occurred in the source file
        found_type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type of the operator's operand
        res_type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type which is the result of the coercion for the operator's operand

      • addConditionTypeCoercionWarning

        public void addConditionTypeCoercionWarning​(int line,
                                            int char_pos,
                                            java.lang.String found_type,
                                            java.lang.String res_type)
        Creates a new ConditionCoercionWarning instance and adds it to the list of type warnings. Use this method to add new coercion warnings for conditions to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Condition: Found type: 'found_type'. Coerced to: 'res_type'"

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the coercion occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the coercion occurred in the source file
        found_type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type of the operator's operand
        res_type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type which is the result of the coercion for the operator's operand

        public void addUndefIdError​(int line,
                            int char_pos,
                            java.lang.String id)
        Creates a new UndefIdError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new undefined id errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Usage of undefined identifier 'id'"

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the identifier

      • addDoesNotHaveFieldError

        public void addDoesNotHaveFieldError​(int line,
                                     int char_pos,
                                     java.lang.String class_id,
                                     java.lang.String field_id)
        Creates a new DoesNotHaveFieldError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new does not have field errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " 'class_id' does not have field 'field_id'"

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        class_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the class's identifier
        field_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the field's identifier

      • addUndefMethodError

        public void addUndefMethodError​(int line,
                                int char_pos,
                                java.lang.String method_id,
                                java.lang.String... param_types)
        Creates a new UndefMethodError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new undefined method errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Call to undefined method 'method_id(param_types)'"

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        method_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the method's identifier
        param_types - a series of strings containing the Jova source code representation of the parameters' types

      • addCannotInvokeError

        public void addCannotInvokeError​(int line,
                                 int char_pos,
                                 java.lang.String class_id,
                                 java.lang.String method_id,
                                 java.lang.String... arg_types)
        Creates a new CannotInvokeError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new cannot invoke errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Cannot invoke method 'method_id(arg_types)' on type 'class_id' "

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        class_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the class's identifier
        method_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the method's identifier
        arg_types - a series of strings containing the Jova source code representation of the arguments' types

        Parameters:

        class_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the class's identifier

      • addVarDoubleDefError

        public void addVarDoubleDefError​(int line,
                                 int char_pos,
                                 java.lang.String var_id,
                                 java.lang.String var_type,
                                 java.lang.String method_id,
                                 java.lang.String... param_types)
        Creates a new VarDoubleDefTypeError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new variable double definition errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Double definition of variable 'var_type var_id' in method 'method_id(param_types)' "

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        var_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the variable's identifier
        var_type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the variable's type
        method_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the method's identifier
        param_types - a series of strings containing the Jova source code representation of the parameters' types

      • addMethodDoubleDefError

        public void addMethodDoubleDefError​(int line,
                                    int char_pos,
                                    java.lang.String method_id,
                                    java.lang.String class_id,
                                    java.lang.String... param_types)
        Creates a new MethodDoubleDefTypeError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new method double definition errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Double definition of method 'method_id(param_types)' class 'class_id' "

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        method_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the method's identifier
        class_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the class's identifier
        param_types - a series of strings containing the Jova source code representation of the parameters' types

      • addMemberDoubleDefError

        public void addMemberDoubleDefError​(int line,
                                    int char_pos,
                                    java.lang.String mem_id,
                                    java.lang.String mem_type,
                                    java.lang.String class_scope)
        Creates a new MemberDoubleDefTypeError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new member double definition errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Double definition of member 'mem_type mem_id' in class 'class_id' "

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        mem_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the member's identifier
        mem_type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the member's type; that is the member which triggered the error, not the memeber already defined earlier
        class_scope - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the memeber's class

      • addClassDoubleDefError

        public void addClassDoubleDefError​(int line,
                                   int char_pos,
                                   java.lang.String class_id)
        Creates a new ClassDoubleDefTypeError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new class double definition errors to errors.

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        class_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the class's identifier

      • addMemberAccessError

        public void addMemberAccessError​(int line,
                                 int char_pos,
                                 java.lang.String mem_id,
                                 java.lang.String class_id)
        Creates a new MemberAccessError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new member access errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Field 'mem_id' from type 'class_id' not visible "

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        mem_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the member's identifier
        class_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the class's identifier

      • addMethodAccessError

        public void addMethodAccessError​(int line,
                                 int char_pos,
                                 java.lang.String method_id,
                                 java.lang.String class_id,
                                 java.lang.String... param_types)
        Creates a new MethodAccessError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new method access errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Method 'method_id(param_types)' from type 'class_id' not visible "

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        method_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the method's identifier; the method's signature should result together with the given param_types
        class_id - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the class's identifier
        param_types - a series of strings containing the Jova source code representation of the parameters' types; the method's signature should be result together with the given method_id

      • addBinaryTypeError

        public void addBinaryTypeError​(int line,
                               int char_pos,
                               java.lang.String lhs_type,
                               java.lang.String rhs_type,
                               java.lang.String op)
        Creates a new BinaryTypeError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new binary type errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Operator 'op' not defined for 'lhs_type', 'rhs_type' "

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        lhs_type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type of the operator's left-hand side operand
        rhs_type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type of the operator's right-hand side operand
        op - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the operator for which the error occurred

      • addUnaryTypeError

        public void addUnaryTypeError​(int line,
                              int char_pos,
                              java.lang.String type,
                              java.lang.String op)
        Creates a new UnaryTypeError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new unary type errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Operator 'op' not defined for 'type' "

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type of the operand
        op - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the operator for which the error occurred

      • addIncompatibleReturnTypeError

        public void addIncompatibleReturnTypeError​(int line,
                                           int char_pos,
                                           java.lang.String type)
        Creates a new IncompatibleReturnTypeError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new incompatible return type errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Incompatible type 'type' for return "

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type of the evaluated expression to be returned

      • addIncompatibleCondTypeError

        public void addIncompatibleCondTypeError​(int line,
                                         int char_pos,
                                         java.lang.String type)
        Creates a new IncompatibleCondTypeError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new incompatible condition type errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Incompatible type 'type' for condition "

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
        type - a string containing the Jova source code representation of the type of the evaluated expression used as condition

      • addMainInstatiationError

        public void addMainInstatiationError​(int line,
                                     int char_pos)
        Creates a new MainInstantiationError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new main instantiation errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Main cannot be used as a type"

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file

      • addMainMemberError

        public void addMainMemberError​(int line,
                               int char_pos)
        Creates a new MainMemberError instance and adds it to the list of type errors. Use this method to add new main member errors to errors.

        Uses the JovaErrorFactory to generate a JovaError with the message of the form: " Cannot add member to class Main"

        Parameters:
        line - the line's number where the error occurred in the source file
        char_pos - the character position in the line where the error occurred in the source file
